text: Still one of the most relaxing gaming experiences I've had, which can seem strange since you're mostly busy figuring out how to move forward using your blocks. The dreamy visual and audio presentation makes you feel like you're in a digital spa. It's a game I absolutely want to play through again with VR.

author: Licinius Varrus

text: I still don't fully get it... so is Best VGM 1984-20XX about your favourite games that you played that year? or the game that got released back then with the best soundtrack over all, or just a single favourite track of that year? I ask since I remember this being a very highly regarded game of yours in your best of 2014 list or something like that, so the first assumption would make sense, but i'm kinda wondering if you really had nothing better to play in 2009 than shatter? (Don't get me wrong, that's an awesome game too and imho one with the best OSTs overall, so maybe the second statement is the truer one after all?)
author: Evu

text: I'd say it's a mix. Sometimes it's from my favorite game of that year, sometimes my favorite soundtrack, sometimes simply a game that was released that year which I felt could get a spot now.
